intro: Papaver rhoeas var. dubium, commonly known as the scarlet poppy, is a variant of the common poppy characterized by its striking red flowers. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and fields. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and showy, cup-shaped flowers. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing copious amounts of nectar that attract pollinators. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its vibrant color and historical significance in agriculture and symbolism.
